text: [Music]
hi
i'm steve schmidt i'm the chief
information security officer here at aws
i'd like to welcome you to verified
presented by aws reinforce
where we'll be discussing the latest in
cyber security privacy and the cloud
today i'm joined by emma smith the
global cyber security director for
vodafone
emma very good to see you thanks for
joining us today
we've spoken in the past about how in
many cases the sort of traditional
approach to security is finding ways to
stop
things from happening to prevent things
from occurring
and i think that you'll agree with me
that that's
certainly one way to approach the
problem but it doesn't allow businesses
to get to the next level
to really figure out where they want to
be in the future and what we need to do
is to move to situations where
businesses feel like the security
organization is an accelerant
or something that builds trust in the in
the business itself
could you give me a little bit of
information about how
vodafone approaches the process of
security
and building a culture of security
within the company itself
the culture of the company is really
important when you're thinking about the
culture of the security team
um it's a very optimistic culture inside
vodafone which means that you know
there's no limit in boundaries which is
great
and we've got four core beliefs that are
part of what we call our vodafone spirit
and spirit is the way that we think
about culture and the way things work in
the company
and they are about earning customer
loyalty
about how to experiment and learn fast
about creating the future and about
getting things done together
and they give really great hooks for me
for the security culture and how
security fits into that overall dynamic
so we very much try and align with the
the company culture
it's a high-energy company um curious
very very serious about inclusion and
diversity so that all sets a great
foundation i think for the security team
and then just to give you sort of break
that down we did a lot of work in the
security team about
why do we get out of bed in the morning
why do we care so much so really
thinking about our purpose
and that was the the foundations really
about how we went about creating culture
we've got a team of people who are
ultimately passionate about protecting
customers protecting society protecting
vodafone and protecting
all of our services and our employees
and so that was at the core of most of
the people in our team that we spoke to
you talked then about enabling business
and we think that's a core part of our
culture is that we're there to enable
the success of our business
not to be a blocker sometimes easier
said than done but we really really
aspire to be that
that enabler for future connectivity
and then a big part of our role is about
supporting national security in the
countries that we operate in and we'll
core part of critical national
infrastructure and that's a big
motivator to make sure that we
we stay secure um and then i think
probably like a lot of um security teams
we like to think that we are
putting our expertise to good um in
order to fight bad and to fight criminal
activity so
so all of that melded together starts to
um to shape the foundations of the
culture
it's interesting that you started with a
discussion about the customer that's a
an objective that we share where we both
focus on the customer first and then
work backwards from there so how has the
organization the security organization
changed over the time you've been there
um it's more global
than it was before i was lucky i
inherited an organization where in each
country that we operate there was a
cyber or information security team it
was actually called technology security
back then and seen as more of a back
office function i would say
and we've done a lot of work with my
leadership team to really connect
all of the country teams and create one
cyber security vertical across the whole
company
and that's made a big difference to how
we interact all the decision making's
joined people feel they've got a choice
in strategy it's been
probably the most important change that
we've made
we then built out some centralized
capabilities
where they were very federated before so
cyber defense and security operations
been an example so that we can get
get get scale get depth of expertise
you know do things once and reuse them
many times and get some consistency of
process
so that that's probably been the biggest
second change
and then i mentioned the strategy
creating one global strategy
involving all of our countries in the
development of that strategy
and then we worked with the corporate
securities team to create one security
strategy for vodafone so
that includes fraud business continuity
investigations and
that was a big step change about
bringing those two teams together
aligned around a single strategy and
made communication with
the rest of the company um a lot easier
and then we've invested in people so a
couple of examples we've done a lot of
insourcing of critical skills critical
roles
trying to make sure we've got people
with vodafone badges making the really
important decisions
we've worked hard on technical career
paths i think we've got good
management and leadership career paths
before but working hard to to create
more technical career paths and really
reward people for technical expertise
and then it worked very hard on gender
diversity i think we were when i joined
nine percent women um globally and we're
now over 30
so trying to get some gender diversity
in the team
and then the most recent thing i'm proud
of is we've we've developed a cyber
leadership academy
um which so far we've taken 40 of our
cyber leadership team
through which is specifically about
developing the leadership skills needed
to be
a person working in security and we've
it's not just a generic leadership
program we've tried to tailor it for all
the aspects of the cso's role
and the security leader role so that
they can
can learn and have and have some
training and it's also really important
for their career development
so that's been a been a great success
and since we're talking about people
let's talk a little bit about diversity
i know that you were named a diversity

can you tell us a little bit more about

area
yeah i can i was i was delighted
actually i was also very surprised my

let me know they'd nominated me until i
had to record a video to say thank you
so it was it was great it meant a lot
probably better than winning a security
award actually winning
winning a diversity award in our
industry
um my passion i think stems from my dad
actually so he i've got a sister
and he brought us both up to be very
anti-prejudiced
and with a sense that we could you know
be happy in life and do what we wanted
to do so there was no real boundaries
set for us
um and i think as and i went never went
to school or started work thinking i'm a
girl or i'm a woman i was
just me and i think as i've grown older
and as i've had more experiences i've
observed discrimination
and i've and i've experienced it and i
think that makes
first of all it made me think i had to
work even harder to prove myself
and to try and be something perhaps that
i wasn't now what it makes me realize is
that my job's to smooth the way for
everybody else
and to try and remove some of those
obstacles or barriers that were put in
their way so
that's where it stems from and it means
that i'm really passionate about
trying to get a very diverse team in
security but also in vodafone so that we
reflect our customer base
so that we've got diversity of thinking
of backgrounds
experience and people who genuinely feel
comfortable being themselves at work
which is easy to say but
really hard to create that culture of
safety and belonging so
super passionate about it i was very
proud to get the award
it was great it is it is very true and i

when you walk into a building if the

is set properly really helps people

and i'm sort of wondering if there are

online
because it does take as you point out

yeah it does i think um i do think i

kind of the actual device that you're

wherever you connect into because you

branding in the tools that we use and
the look and feel
some of our online networks have been

like
create an allies portal
it was originally started for lgbt but
the idea is you go and learn about how

to support other groups and to be you

so
i think some of those online portals do

how do we maintain that when everybody

we used to do some big events where we'd

in regional hubs and we celebrate

talk about some of the achievements and

and i think it will replicate very well

maybe not give the same the same

when we get back to normal whatever that

it'll be very interesting to see how we

it's reinforced for us some of the

we know already and some of the

as formalizing those or already pushing

and get things that are more role-based

i i really enjoyed it and the thing that

especially in the the space of diversity

improve the way our businesses operate

to ensure that all of our staff feel
